I have a quick question about how do melee Battle Clerics without UMD deal with Damage Shields?

Assuming low elemental DR and Caster level that cannot be dispelled, how does one solve this?

Also, Heal/Harm has been nerfed.

Example : Let us say there is an Epic level Dragon that can cast Damage Shields.  It also has multiple Heals, etc.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
1. Wait until they drop
2. Use extended silence
3. Use offensive spells
4. Use a DI summons (depends on the Module)
5. Use a twohanded weapon and much healing
6. Use a thrown weapon
7. Use sequencers/items
8. Throw a pocket Dwarf at it

If none of those work, I take my ball and go home

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
You said battle cleric. Is it pure cleric or have you muddied the waters? And if you muddied it, what dirts did you muck with?

With or without umd, battle clerics reach a point of diminishing returns in some respects because they lack a knock out punch for those end game bosses. Sure, they do great melee damage all the time, and they can slap harms about, but on rare occasions that’s not enough.

You said he’s resistant to Silence. Did you cast it on him or yourself? If on you then he likely has Auto Silence. If on him, well, don’t do that.

Against damage shields itself: stay ranged and keep buffs maxed on your ranged weapon and projectiles. Divine favor (extended/hasted/rapidshot/divine power). If you have divine might even better. Keep a steady supply of level 7-9 summons for him to chew on while you unleash holy hell from down range.

Finally, get a crew. One shouldn’t hunt elder wyrms alone.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
In my experience, there is a list of core things in NWN you have to mitigate/manage in some fashion. This, of course, is further influenced by how a module is designed/gated.

In most modules UMD is the strongest mechanism for mitigation outside of your build focusing on the class itself and your item matrix.

Once you take UMD away from the equation, those holes become very apparent.

Clerics, on most worlds, have a single gaping hole in my experience which is lack of breach capability.

UMD is the easiest way to mitigate this but usually on any world built to allow soloing, there are items.

posts.author: The Flying Rodent
posts.content:
I think the simple answer is that “you don’t have the right build type for this enemy”.

If the dragon has very high SR, given the max allowed in the toolset is 32SR, then your build most likely doesn’t have many cleric levels to penetrate ~32 SR... which means that it can’t use offensive spells against an obviously anti-melee countermeasure.

Battle clerics are strong, but that doesn’t make them capable of doing everything (although, as has already been stated, UMD helps a lot in medium-high magic environments with plenty of scrolls available). I’d recommend requesting the help of a friendly mage to breach the shield for you. Might be easier then. :)

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Silence doesn't work well with large creature models since it's hard to make the AoE overlap with the creature's position. It's possible that the dragon doesn't have Silent Spell and is just outside of the Silence aura when it casts.

Have you tried counterspelling the heals? If it heals via a monster ability then you're out of luck, but if it actually casts a spell then you should be able to counterspell them and reduce the fight time.

In general casters are the biggest problem for battle clerics, so as The Flying Rodent said you might just have to accept that it's a bad matchup.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: I just did some testing with a sequencer. Mords and GDispel both fit on the sequencer but when used they only work as though targeted on the caster. GSBreach doesn't work on the sequencer because it counts as an offensive spell. So you can Mord/dispel yourself but it won't dispel AoEs or breach any enemies.
